Rev 9202 again but configuration initialized with default configuration.

QE notes: from Gordon: We've had so much trouble with the Enter key that I think we need some (or more?) Mustella tests for it, including testing it after toggling the multiline property, and testing it with both 'text', 'content', and 'textFlow'.
Tests run: checkintests, NumericStepper, TextInput and TextArea
Transferred from the Adobe Open Source Subversion Repository
Transferred from the Adobe Open Source Subversion Repository

RET was intercepting the enter key for the !multiline case and allowing it to go to TLF for the multiline case but that doesn't work since the TLF EditManager.keyUpHandler() doesn't check event.isDefaultPrevented() and does a event.stopImmediatePropogration() on the enter key.
Now we never let TLF handle the enter key.  That means for the multiline case we needed to duplicate the code from the EditManager which is never a good thing to do but unavoidable.

QE notes: from Gordon: We've had so much trouble with the Enter key that I think we need some (or more?) Mustella tests for it, including testing it after toggling the multiline property, and testing it with both 'text', 'content', and 'textFlow'.
Transferred from the Adobe Open Source Subversion Repository

Per Hans, if TextArea and lineBreak=”toFit”, set the scroller’s horinzontalScrollPolicy to “off”.  Added a “styleChanged” event to RET so that TextArea.  If lineBreak="toFit" the scroller's horizontalScrollPolicy style is set to off.  If lineBreak="explicit" the scroller's horizontalScrollPolicy style is set auto if it off.  RET's horizontalScrollPolicy is auto in both of these cases.
Modified getEditManager() and endEditManager() so that all the edits for each API call are grouped together as a composite operation on the undo queue.  Ctrl-z should undo the entire API call.
Is noteworthy for integration: possibly - the RET api calls insertText(), appendText() and setFormatOfRange() add a single composite operation do TLF's undo queue

Spark RichEditableText doesn't display focus rect when clicking in the text (unlike TextArea and TextInput)
